p: Results: 82 patients included in the study, 37 (45.1 %) were male and 45 female (54.9 %) with a mean age of 57 ± 20 years. The main cause of admission was septic shock in 57.3 %. Creatinine levels and time uresis uNGAL significant differences with a probability less than 0.05. The cutoff for the diagnosis of acute kidney injury admission was 166.8 ng / ml, and the outcome of severe acute kidney injury, the income cutoff was 306.35 ng / ml.
